Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and identify the different kinds of living things in a specific land habitat, like a garden or forest.
The student can draw and identify the different kinds of living things in a specific water habitat, like a pond or stream.
The student can show different types of plants, such as trees, grasses, and flowering plants, in both land and water habitats.
The student can show different types of animals, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams, in both land and water habitats.
The student can compare the types of living things found in different habitats by drawing both habitats and their inhabitants side by side.
The student can organize and label their drawings clearly to show the types of plants and animals observed in each habitat.
